thread.title: Xiaomi Redmi Pro 2 expected to be powered by octa-core Snapdragon 660
thread.title_full: Xiaomi Redmi Pro 2 expected to be powered by octa-core Snapdragon 660

title: Xiaomi Redmi Pro 2 expected to be powered by octa-core Snapdragon 660
text:
Xiaomi Redmi Pro 2 expected to be powered by octa-core Snapdragon 660 Xiaomi Redmi Pro 2 expected to be powered by octa-core Snapdragon 660   Redmi Pro 2 is expected to be announced in Q2 this year, when the Snapdragon 660 will go official‚Äù 
According to a report out of China, Xiaomi is working on a new smartphone that will be powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 660 processor. The report has also revealed the specifications of the Snapdragon 660, which is expected to go official later this year. Reports suggest that the recently-leaked Xiaomi Redmi Pro 2 will be the one that can be expected to be powered by the Snapdragon 660.As per the source, the Qualcomm Snapdragon 660 will carry the model number MSM8976 Plus. Its model number is similar to that of the Snapdragon 652 and 653 SoCs. However, unlike the SD652 and 653 that were using the 28nm fabrication process, the SD660 will be made using a 14nm process.The report reveals that the Snapdragon 660 is likely to have its own custom Kryo cores similar to the Snapdragon 820 flagship. It will have four Cortex A73 CPUs clocked at 2.2GHz and four Cortex A53 processors clocked at 1.9GHz. The SoC will have an Adreno 512 GPU, two LPDDR4 RAMs clocked at 1,866MHz and UFA 2.1 storage support.Qualcomm is expected to begin mass production of the Snapdragon 660 in the second quarter of this year. So, we can expect the Xiaomi Redmi Pro 2 to be unveiled around the same time.
